The Story of the Ghost who Appeared in the Air
“You are going along in the air,
on the Ganges here;
You are a ghost with your private parts exposed,
wearing a garland, adorned;🔽Where will you go, ghost?
Where will your dwelling be?”
“I will go to Cundaṭṭhila,”
the ghost said this;
In between there is the village of Vāsabha,
and near Bārāṇasī.”
And the minister,
known as Koliya,
having seen him, gave the ghost
flour, rice, and a pair of yellow robes.
While the boat was standing,🔽he had it given to the cook;
when it was given to the cook,
it was seen in the ghost’s place.
Then, well-clothed,
wearing a garland, adorned;🔽in his place the ghost stood,
and received the offering on the right;
Therefore, out of compassion,
give again and again to the ghosts.
Some are clothed in their own hair,
others in the husks of sesame seeds;
the ghosts go for their meal,
they go out in all directions.
Some, having run a long way,
and then turn back without getting anything.
They are hungry, thirsty, exhausted,
and are rolled around on the ground.
And when they fall down there,
and are rolled around on the ground,
they are like those who have not previously done good,
and are burned by fire in the hot season.
